item.title: Europe markets edge lower as investors await euro zone inflation data; Anglo American up 3%
item.description: European stocks were slightly lower on Friday as investors awaited the release of euro zone inflation data.

item.title: Adani Green soars 19% as group stocks recover sharply amid ongoing U.S. legal challenges
item.description: Shares in India's Adani Group have been rallying on the back of the group's statement refuting bribery charges against its billionaire chairman, Gauta...

item.title: Apple, Trump and a booming budget surplus: Ireland has much to mull over as voters head to the polls
item.description: A budget surplus and concerns over U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's upcoming tax policies are some of the economic questions facing Ireland.

item.title: South Korea stocks lead declines in Asia-Pacific as its industrial production contracts in October
item.description: Tokyo's headline inflation rate came in at 2.6%, rebounding from the 1.8% seen in October.

item.title: UK transport minister quits in new blow to PM Starmer
